Description: Fragment of lower wall of East Greek pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora or oinochoe; fine beige-buff clay with white inclusions and no visible mica; highly polished surface; exterior: chequerboard pattern consisting of black grid with red dots in alternate squares, above pair of black bands, with second pair of bands below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.053)
